subject: Mental Health
title: Family-Based Treatment
description: A quick win: understand Family-Based Treatment.

hook.text: The most effective treatment for teen anorexia puts parents in charge of refeeding.

buildup.text: FBT, or the Maudsley approach, empowers parents as the primary agents of recovery.

discovery.text: Parents take over meal planning and supervision until the teen can eat independently.

twist.text: This reversed decades of blaming parents for causing eating disorders.

climax.text: FBT has the strongest evidence base for adolescent anorexia of any treatment.

punchline.text: Parents went from being blamed to being the cure.

quiz.question: What does family-based treatment involve?
options: Parents take charge of the teen's refeeding and meal supervision
Removing the teen from the family
Only individual therapy for the teen
